url: What happened to the actress Ashley Judd in the Congo rainforest?
text_blocks:
What happened to the actress Ashley Judd in the Congo rainforest?,'
',She was hiking in the Democratic Republic of the Congo before dawn, while doing research bonobos.

She didn‚Äôt have proper lighting to guide her and slipped and fell after her ankle got caught on roots and it fractured her tibia and leg in several places. The total rescue took 55 hours, and she was carried out in a hammock. Her right leg had no pulse and nearly needed to be amputated.

It‚Äôs a good example of why it‚Äôs important to carry proper communication equipment with you when out in the wilderness. If there is no cell phone signal, that still isn‚Äôt an excuse. There are satellite phones you can carry with you. This also includes traveling alone on a boat somewhere.

If you don‚Äôt, you will realize just how big this planet is, and how alone you‚Äôll suddenly feel. Be safe.

url: What small detail in a movie that most people probably miss is your favorite?
text_blocks:
What small detail in a movie that most people probably miss is your favorite?,'
',People have probably pointed this out already. But I definitely missed this the first time I watched Endgame. When Thanos attacks the Avengers compound and blows Scott back. His suit automatically senses the danger; and shrinks him down in order to minimize the damage. I think this is a great touch. It's always nice when movies add detail to something that doesn't need it. They could've just let the scene play out as you'd expect it to. But they went the extra mile. Gotta love it.

url: Do you think the "animal" movie is sending a bad message to society?
text_blocks:
Do you think the "animal" movie is sending a bad message to society?,'
',Let's see, the movie has plenty of inappropriate scenes which can give negative impacts to the viewers, especially the family audience. The movie is filled with explicit scenes and violence. For example there are scenes where the lead character played by Ranbir kills almost a 100 men, in a gorey over the top way. There are scenes with Rashmika where Ranbir try to establish his perspective about Manliness and the whole Alpha male narrative on her. There are instaces where he cross the line and has a extramarital affair with another woman. All these things were against my morality.That been said, coming to the question,

Do you think the "animal" movie is sending a bad message to society?

Before answering this question let me tell you a story. Trust me it will make sense in the end. So bear with me.

Once there was a man who used to drink alot. He used to drink day and night. And on getting drunk he used to physically abuse his wife and two children. Everyday the father did this and made a living hell for his family. Years passed and the two kids of the man grew up. The First boy became a drunk just like his father. When asked about this, the man replied, my father was a big drunkard. He abused me and my mother. And I grew up watching this. So obviously me also gonna end up like my father right? I became like this because of my father. When same was asked to the second man, he replied, I never touched alcohol in my life. I grew up watching my dad beat my mom and my brother after he gets drunk. Alcohol ruined our life. So I decided that day itself that, I will never touch alcohol in my life.

Now look at the story. Two boys grown in same situation yet both chose to be different. One boy took tge situation negatively while the other in a positive sense.Cinema is just like this only. Ofcourse it is a good media to give messages to society, but it doesn't mean it will or have to give good messages. Some people tends to show their upbringings and tries to blame it on cinema.Cinema is a source of entertainment in the end. It is upto the viewers to take their stance. Like the boys from the story. You have the power to let it influence you or not.

Does animal put forwards a bad message to the society? Ofcourse it does! Because it's a story about a disturbed man with mental issues. He will do things based on his mental state and narrow perspective. And the movie is rated A for a reason. You don't expect devotional things from an adult movie right?

I don't see anybody complaining about the morality in a adult web series like this.

So what's so special about animal? Just because it has big actors in it, the movie is not liable to a good messaging to society. In the end you are seeing a vision of a director and you always have an option to not see it or not.

Thanks for reading.

url: Is Emma Watson a more popular actress than Jennifer Lowrance?
text_blocks:
Is Emma Watson a more popular actress than Jennifer Lowrance?,'
',Who is the more popular actress between Emma Watson and Jennifer Lawrence? It‚Äôs a tough question to answer definitively. Both actresses have achieved great success in their careers, starring in hit films and winning numerous awards.

According to IMDb, Jennifer Lawrence has a higher starmeter score compared to Emma Watson. This means that she has received higher ratings from IMDb users. On the other hand, Emma Watson boasts a larger following on social media, suggesting a potentially larger fan base.

In the end, determining popularity is subjective. Some may prefer Jennifer Lawrence‚Äôs acting style, while others may lean towards Emma Watson‚Äôs performances. At the end of the day, it boils down to personal preference ‚Äì there‚Äôs no right or wrong answer here.

url: In the movie The Whale, did Brandan Frazier gain all the weight, or did he have a fat suit on?
text_blocks:
In the movie The Whale, did Brandan Frazier gain all the weight, or did he have a fat suit on?,'
',That‚Äôs a question that sparked quite a bit of conversation, especially after images started floating around of a nearly unrecognizable Fraser‚Äîsomeone we‚Äôre more used to seeing in action-hero form from his "Mummy" days.

The truth is, Hollywood has become incredibly adept at using prosthetics and makeup to transform actors beyond recognition. For "The Whale," Fraser went through an intensive makeup process, wearing a fat suit that looked extremely realistic. The suit was designed to make his character‚Äîa reclusive English teacher suffering from severe obesity‚Äîappear as authentic as possible.

The transformative makeup and fat suit took hours to apply each filming day. I mean, it‚Äôs part and parcel of the craft, right? These days, performances aren‚Äôt just about getting inside a character's head. Sometimes, you've also got to inhabit their body, abstractly or physically.

Brendan Fraser underwent a lot of scrutiny with his physical appearance over the years, and this role just adds a whole new dimension to his career and physical transformations. Not only did it challenge him as an actor, but it also goes to show just how far film prosthetics have come in creating believable representations of all body types.

It's a powerful movie with a poignant performance that didn't require the health risks of massively altering body weight‚Äîproviding food for thought, without the need for a dietary overhaul.

Portland's rainy days give me plenty of time to cosy up with these deeply human stories, remind me of how versatile actors like Fraser can be, and how makeup and costume can bring stories like this to life without compromising the performer's well-being.

url: Which replacement actor in a TV show or movie will always be more closely associated with that show or film than the original actor they replaced?
text_blocks:
Which replacement actor in a TV show or movie will always be more closely associated with that show or film than the original actor they replaced?,'
',The TV show ‚ÄúCheers‚Äù had several.

Remember Coach Ernie Pantusso?

He was replaced by a young actor named Woody Harrelson, chosen to be dumber and less attractive than the ‚Äústar‚Äù Ted Danson. Coincidentally, the character was also named Woody. Woody, unlike Ted, of course went on to super stardom, leaving Danson in the dust, and was one of the most memorable and lovable characters of the show.

And then there was Shelly Long, whom idiot writers way back then imagined to be what America wanted, an airhead blonde matched with the doofus bartender. I doubt they resonated much with anyone.

However her replacement, Kirstie Alley, brought the series back to life. Kirstie back then was hot, no, all in caps HOT.

In my opinion, this was the cast that made the series great, along with Kelsey Grammer as Frasier Crane:

With all due respects, the original cast will be known as the ‚Äúpractice squad.‚Äù It was a work in progress at that point.

url: What are the best productivity hacks, tips, tools or resources for a project manager?
text_blocks:
What are the best productivity hacks, tips, tools or resources for a project manager?,'
',At Asana
, we‚Äôve spent years developing the best work management platform
 for team management and collaboration, which we believe is the backbone of productivity. When your team is organized and connected, you can improve productivity, reduce ‚Äúwork about work
‚Äù like ineffective meetings and email bloat, and do better work.

So if you‚Äôre looking to avoid the roadblocks that hinder productivity for even the best of teams, look no further. Here are eight tips for improving team organization and connection and‚Äîin turn‚Äîboosting both the speed and quality of your team‚Äôs work:

Eliminate unnecessary meetings

Meetings are productive if and when there‚Äôs a clear agenda, the right people attend, and everyone is prepared to contribute to a solution. However, if this isn‚Äôt the case, even short meetings can add up and eat into time your team has to work toward tangible goals.

To avoid that, share a meeting agenda
 in Asana beforehand so everyone is on the same page. Create sections where collaborators can ask async questions and identify the work that‚Äôs most important to talk about. After the meeting, identify action items within the same Asana project, so no work falls through the cracks.

Prioritize work based on key results

Employees have many important tasks across multiple projects, but it can be hard for team members to know where they should devote the bulk of their time and brainpower. With Asana custom fields
, assign each task a priority or status level. That way team members can prioritize work that ladders up to company-wide objectives.

Having a well-defined set of goals and clear understanding of how work ladders up to those goals
 will empower team members to make decisions that impact the big picture. And, if a project isn‚Äôt connected to a larger company goal, rethink whether it‚Äôs necessary or not in the first place.

Delete, defer, delegate, or diminish

Asana surveyed over 10,000 global workers to find out how we really spend our time at work
. We found that a surprisingly small portion of the day actually goes toward skilled work and big-picture planning. To eliminate the busywork standing between you and substantive tasks, remember the four D‚Äôs:

If an aspect of a project does not support an overarching company goal‚Äîdelete it.
If there is a more pressing project that has a greater impact on team goals, complete that task and defer a less important task for when you have more time.
If there are two tasks of equal importance assigned to one person, delegate one of those tasks to another team member with more bandwidth.
If there‚Äôs a task you can‚Äôt defer, delete, or delegate, find ways to diminish the amount of time it takes to complete. For example, you can eliminate related meetings or work on just the highest priority parts of the task.

Leverage your team‚Äôs strengths

No two employees are alike. Each person has different experiences, strengths, and weaknesses that make them a valued member of your team. When assigning work, be sure each individual‚Äôs task is one they are not only suited for, but also will enjoy completing. Giving your team tasks they find personally rewarding or challenging can help everyone to do their best work.

Additionally, proactively identify and prevent burnout so your team is always doing their best work. Workload
 allows team members to assign time or capacity to tasks, so you can preemptively address overwork. Reassign tasks and rebalance responsibilities to make sure your team gets the right work done at the right time.

Map out a plan before beginning

Once you know what needs to be done and who will do it, you then need to define a well-thought plan that can eliminate ‚Äúwork about work,‚Äù like status updates and email bloat. Start by establishing a clear timeline for each project, and make sure everyone knows who‚Äôs doing what by when.

Using a work management tool can help you set up all of the smaller tasks that lead to accomplishing a larger goal. Making use of existing or custom templates
 in Asana can help you replicate a process that‚Äôs worked before and be certain nothing slips through the cracks.

Encourage cross-functional collaboration

Just because you work in a different department doesn‚Äôt mean you can‚Äôt work together. After all, you‚Äôre working toward the same goal as part of a larger company. Knowing what other teams are working on can encourage teams to collaborate
 with one another when work and goals overlap.

Work management tools can increase cross-team visibility, mapping each phase of a project back to a singular set of goals. These tools can serve as a centralized hub to share what you‚Äôre working on with the rest of the team and identify areas where people of different responsibilities can collaborate.

Promote no-meeting days

Meetings can disrupt your flow, making it harder to ‚Äúget in the zone‚Äù and finish a project. Having at least one full day devoted to deep work‚Äîthat sweet, sweet block of several uninterrupted hours‚Äîcan go a long way toward improving efficiency and productivity.

At Asana, we have No Meeting Wednesday, which allows everyone to be heads-down in work instead of just talking about work. As a result, the team has more time to execute critical processes on projects. Many employees cite No Meeting Wednesday as their favorite day of the week and often see projects cross the finish line on Hump Day.

Alternatively, give your team more freedom to set their own deep work blocks with Asana features like Do Not Disturb
. Notify your team that you‚Äôre working but not receiving notifications, and keep clear lines of communication open.

Define the purpose of different communication channels

Communication tools are only useful if your team knows how and when to use them. Using them inconsistently or having multiple channels for the same use can actually create more confusion and inefficiency than the tools were meant to eliminate in the first place.

It‚Äôs important to clearly define the purpose of each communication channel. For example, this is how we use communication tools at Asana:

For outside communication with vendors and clients, stick to email.
For immediate answers to questions, use an app like Slack
.
To plan, manage, and communicate about actionable work, stick to a work management tool like Asana
.

Improving team collaboration and connection increases productivity

Improving productivity is a continuous process. It may seem overwhelming, but simple organization tools and collaboration tactics can help make everyone on your team more connected‚Äîand more efficient. Learn more about how Asana
 can help make you and your team be more efficient, and try Asana for free today.

url: If Darth Maul and Count Dooku were to team up against Darth Vader, who would win?
text_blocks:
If Darth Maul and Count Dooku were to team up against Darth Vader, who would win?,'
',As powerful as Vader is, this is overkill.

Vader is not only facing one of the greatest duelists of their time (Count Dooku),

but also one of the most powerful force users of their time (Darth Maul).

Both of these guys were no joke. They were apprentices to Darth Sidious himself and had taken on some of the most powerful Jedi of their time. Vader could likely take on either individually, but as a team effort, Vader would definitely go down.

url: What are some of the strangest facts about famous movies?
text_blocks:
What are some of the strangest facts about famous movies?,'
',#1 In 'Spider-Man: Far From Home' (2019), Jake Gyllenhaal can be seen in the background of several scenes.

He wasn't supposed to be there, and later admitted that he just enjoys stalking Tom Holland. I mean who wouldn't stalk Tom HollandüòÇ

#2 The Theory Of Everything

In an e-mail to director James Marsh about the portrayal by Eddie Redmayne, Stephen Hawking said there were certain points when he thought he was watching himself. In addition to his copyrighted voice, Stephen Hawking also lent the filmmakers his Companion of Honour medal and his signed thesis to use as genuine props in the film.

#3 Schindler's List

To gather costumes for 20,000 extras, the costume designer took out advertisements seeking clothes. As economic conditions were poor in Poland, many people were eager to sell clothing they still owned from the 1930s and '40s.

#4 Interstellar

For a cornfield scene, Christopher Nolan sought to grow five hundred acres of corn, which he learned was feasible from his producing of Man of Steel (2013). The corn was then sold, and actually made a profit.

#5 Star Trek

The sound of the automatic doors opening on the U.S.S. Enterprise, is a Russian train's toilet flushing.

#6 Anastasia (1997)

The Drawing That Anastasia Gives To Her Grandmother Is Based On A 1914 Painting Created By The Real Princess Anastasia.

#7 Mulan (1998)

Mulan touches her hair a lot because the animators noticed that Mulan‚Äôs voice actor, Ming-Na Wen, touched her hair a lot while recording. So, they added it to the character.

#8 Brave (2012)

You can see Merida and her mother Hidden in the logo of the movie. Look at the top left of the B and E.

#9 The Dark Knight (2008)

Joker is constantly licking his lips. This is actually because of the prosthetic scars that Heath Ledger wore. They kept falling off, so Heath would lick his lips to keep them in place. Gradually, it became a part of the Joker‚Äôs character.

Hope you like these. UPVOTE for updatesüòù

So, if you find yourself in an elevator with Scarlett Johansson, don't forget to let her know just how much you appreciate her talent and presence!

',Margot Robbie went from having a very tough childhood to being the highest-paid actress in Hollywood in 2023.

url: Why wasn't there a big controversy about Robert Downey Jr's portrayal in Tropic Thunder?
text_blocks:
Why wasn't there a big controversy about Robert Downey Jr's portrayal in Tropic Thunder?,'
',In the kingdom of the easily outraged, context should be king.

Both Robert Downey Jr. and Tropic Thunder came under fire in 2008, but the backlash was relatively minimal for several factors.

For starters, most people understood the context in which ‚Äòblackface‚Äô was used in the movie.

Downey Jr. wasn‚Äôt playing Staff Sergeant Lincoln Osiris, an African-American soldier, he was playing Kirk Lazarus, an Australian actor.

Ben Stiller‚Äôs penetrating satire was meant to slice through the very heart of Hollywood.

And Kirk Lazarus is merely yet another conduit for satire‚Äîhe represents the extreme and often ludicrous lengths certain method actors go to for a part, Daniel Day-Lewis being a prime example.

What is doubly clever about this bit is the inclusion of Alpa Chino in the cast within the cast.

He overtly serves as a commentary on the frequently problematic casting choices in films - ‚ÄúThey had one good part in here for a black man and they gave it to Crocodile Dundee!‚Äù

Just like Tom Cruise‚Äôs Les Grossman is a rather glaring illustration of the Harvey Weinstein-type producer; bullish, ruthless, and morally bankrupt.

And Matthew McConaughey‚Äôs Rick Peck satirizes the manipulative characteristics of Hollywood agents.

More so than Robert Downey Jr.‚Äôs ‚Äòblackface,‚Äô Tropic Thunder came under severe fire for Stiller‚Äôs Simple Jack character.

Once again, the film‚Äôs intention is apparent.

The Simple Jack character is in a similar vein to Lazarus - poking fun at the type of performances that traditionally garner Oscars (Tom Hanks in Forrest Gump, Daniel Day-Lewis in My Left Foot).

The film carefully avoids punching down by clarifying that the butt of the joke remain the two obvious characters carrying out the ‚Äúoffense‚Äù - Kirk Lazarus and Tugg Speedman.

It‚Äôs essentially the same scenario, but while the Simple Jack storyline courted controversy, the Lincoln Osiris largely garnered praise.

One reason for that is Robert Downey Jr.‚Äôs mesmeric performance.

It‚Äôs incredible how precise this performance is - He completely disappeared into the character; the body language, the small tics, the manner of his speech, it‚Äôs all there. He transformed.

Downey Jr. remains the only male actor this century to be nominated for an Oscar for a straight comedy.

url: Why is Bruno Tattaglia's death never seen in The Godfather movie?
text_blocks:
Why is Bruno Tattaglia's death never seen in The Godfather movie?,'
',Bruno is introduced to us during his meeting with Sollozo and Luca Brasi. The main point of the introduction is to show his connection to Sollozo and to show how utterly ruthless Bruno is as he participates in the trio of men who kill Luca. When we later discover from Tessio that Bruno was himself killed by Sonny, this is the extent of Bruno‚Äôs death. By this point in the movie, the major focus was on Sonny and the extent he would go while running the family. We are meant to see Sonny as some hothead who is bordering on being ‚Äúout of control‚Äù. Only Tom manages to calm him down and convinces Sonny to ‚Äúwait‚Äù before engaging in an all-out war during Vito‚Äôs convalescence. Showing Bruno being murdered would have been needless violence in an already-violent movie. Just show Tessio curtly telling the family that Sonny ‚Äúhit‚Äù Bruno and showing Clemenza‚Äôs dissatisfaction at what such a hit might cause.

url: Why are there no fat humans in Star Wars?
text_blocks:
Why are there no fat humans in Star Wars?,'
',The "Star Wars" galaxy is a vast expanse of possibilities, teeming with a plethora of species, planets, and cultures. But when it comes to the variation in human body types, particularly the lack of heavier-set humans, there's a noticeable absence. Why is that?

For starters, the "Star Wars" series has always been a sort of space opera, with its roots in mythology and classic storytelling. The heroes and villains are often depicted in ways that are meant to be archetypal, larger-than-life characters, and physicality plays a big part in that portrayal. There's a tendency in visual storytelling to represent heroes and villains in physically idealized forms ‚Äî this often translates into fit and muscular protagonists and antagonists, giving them a larger-than-life presence.

Now, practical considerations also come into play. By the time the original trilogies were being filmed, special effects were nowhere near what they are today. So, actors had to do their own stunts more frequently, and being fit was often a practical requirement of the job. Han Solo ducking laser blasts? Luke Skywalker swinging across chasms? You better believe they needed to be in top shape for those scenes.

Plus, think about the contexts in which we see humans in the "Star Wars" universe. Many of them are soldiers, Jedi, or adventurers, constantly on the move and often in survival situations where food might be scarce and physical demands are high. This lifestyle doesn't lend itself well to sedentary living or over-consuming calories ‚Äî there isn't much room for a Dagobah fast-food chain in the swamps where Yoda lives.

And let's not forget about selective storytelling. "Star Wars" focuses primarily on people directly involved in the action ‚Äî the front-line fighters of the Rebellion, the agile and disciplined Jedi, the menacing figures of the Empire. We don't get a snapshot of what the average civilian in a galaxy far, far away looks like or what their lifestyle entails. For all we know, there are plenty of diverse body shapes and sizes that we simply don't see on screen because they're not integral to the central plot.

But consider this as well, storytelling has historically followed patterns. In traditional epic tales, and indeed in many modern ones, there is often an emphasis on the physical prowess of the heroes. These standards shape our expectations for the genre, sometimes at the expense of diversity, both on screen and off.

Sure, more recent "Star Wars" media, like the TV series "The Mandalorian," have started to show a wider range of human shapes and sizes, but there's still a long way to go. It's a reminder that even in a galaxy with limitless potential for diversity, our own world's biases can seep into the way we create and consume media.

As Scott, living in the green and often rain-drenched lands of Portland, OR, my take is that "Star Wars" is still a product of its time and cultural context, just as much as it is a look into a diverse fictional universe. And as we continue to broaden our understanding of representation, maybe we'll begin to see more of that diversity reflected in the body types of human characters across the galactic spectrum.

url: Has Leonardo DiCaprio aged terribly?
text_blocks:
Has Leonardo DiCaprio aged terribly?,'
',First of all, we must remember that yes, Dicaprio is aging. He is now almost 50 years old, and I am happy to say that he has the typical look of an almost 50-year-old man. In fact, he is a quite attractive man of almost 50 years. You may like boyish looking guys more, but to me, DiCaprio is much more attractive now than he was 20 or 30 years ago. I am your same age.

Okay, it's true that he has gained a little weight, but so do most of us. Still, he hasn't gained much weight, just a little. Marlon Brando also had the same youthful looks and the charm and freshness of a young man, but by the time he starred in Apocalypse Now, he was only a little older than DiCaprio is today, and he was so fat that he could barely move around the filming set. And yet, he managed to retain most of his charisma and charm.

If you push me, I would say that a little extra fat under the skin is beneficial when you are not so young anymore. There are three main ways to prevent wrinkles at age 50: good genetics (something you either have or you don't have, and it's clear that DiCaprio doesn't seem to have it, but he also doesn't have ruined skin like, for example, Robert Redford's when was the same age). DiCaprio does not appear to have undergone many cosmetic interventions on his face (the second option to eliminate wrinkles). He indeed has some lines on his forehead and a bit of crow's feet around his eyes, but not many, just enough to give him an interesting look. The last option to prevent excess wrinkles is when the skin is filled from within, that is, thanks to body weight, and as long as DiCaprio does not gain more weight, his current appearance is more than acceptable.

The problem is that the actor has been appearing on screens since he was a child, and we have seen him playing roles since then, which affects our perception. It seems like it was just yesterday that he filmed ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Eating Gilbert Grape‚Äù almost in his late teens, but in reality it has been almost 30 years.

url: What directors have a reputation of being a real pain to work with, and conversely who are a pleasure to work with?
text_blocks:
What directors have a reputation of being a real pain to work with, and conversely who are a pleasure to work with?,'
',James Cameron has quite a reputation for being difficult to work with.

After starring in Cameron‚Äôs film ‚ÄúThe Abyss‚Äù, both Ed Harris and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio reportedly swore they would never work with him again, because both he and the shoot were so demanding.

Harris very nearly drowned at one point while shooting one of the underwater scenes, but Cameron kept filming. Harris was so furious that he punched Cameron in the face. To this day, he refuses to discuss the making of the film.

**plot spoilers ahead**

Mastrantonio had to film a resuscitation scene in which she was soaking wet, her breasts were exposed, and Harris was pounding on her chest and slapping her in the face repeatedly, and Cameron kept demanding retake after retake. Finally, she had an emotional breakdown, stormed off the set, and refused to return if he didn‚Äôt just wrap the scene already, saying, ‚Äúwe are not animals!‚Äù She, like Harris, is not fond of discussing her experience during filming.

Stanley Kubrick was another director who, although brilliant, was notorious for being difficult, exacting, and highly demanding.

While filming ‚ÄúThe Shining‚Äù, Kubrick was notoriously hard on his cast, most notably Scatman Crothers and especially Shelley Duvall. Duvall was so stressed out during the shoot due to endless retakes and near-constant verbal abuse from Kubrick that she became physically ill and her hair began to fall out. Kubrick also insisted that everyone else on set not be sympathetic toward Duvall, claiming it would hurt her performance. Costar Jack Nicholson would later say he thought Duvall‚Äôs role was the toughest he had ever seen an actress take on, and Kubrick himself also highly praised her performance after the film had wrapped. Duvall, for her part, conceded that Kubrick was probably trying to get her best out of her, but also thought it unfair that Kubrick received all the praise for the finished film, and said it felt ‚Äúlike I wasn‚Äôt even there.‚Äù

69-year-old Crothers, who played cook Dick Hallorann, was also pushed hard. In one scene, Kubrick demanded over 100 takes from him, until Crothers broke down in tears and asked him, ‚ÄúMr. Kubrick, just what do you want from me?‚Äù Nicholson was finally able to convince Kubrick to ease up on Crothers. It‚Äôs said that when Crothers made his next film, ‚ÄúBronco Billy,‚Äù directed by Clint Eastwood - as notoriously easygoing a director as Kubrick was difficult - he again burst into tears: this time of joy, when he realized that he wouldn‚Äôt have to do dozens of takes for each scene. (Incidentally, Kubrick had originally wanted Slim Pickens for the role of Hallorann, but Pickens, having appeared in Kubrick‚Äôs film ‚ÄúDr. Strangelove‚Äù, outright refused to work with him again.)

On the other hand, some directors who are known to be easy to work with and well liked by actors, in addition to Eastwood, include Steven Spielberg, Martin Scorsese, Tim Burton, and Ang Lee.

url: Which actors who can't stand each other have been able to set their differences aside long enough to work together on a movie that became very successful?
text_blocks:
Which actors who can't stand each other have been able to set their differences aside long enough to work together on a movie that became very successful?,'
',One of the most famous examples is probably Patrick Swayze and Jennifer Grey.

They first worked together on Red Dawn, and didn't get along, reportedly having very different personalities ‚Äî Grey somewhat sensitive and emotional, Swayze more ‚Äúmacho‚Äù and prone to making fun.

So when Swayze was cast as her love interest in Dirty Dancing, Grey was said to be none too happy at all. The friction between the two continued throughout filming, with professional dancer Swayze easily losing patience with novice Grey, and Grey becoming emotional when given criticism.

That famous scene where they're practicing the mambo, and he slides his hand down over her underarm? Where she keeps laughing, and he gets frustrated? That was real, and not in the script. Grey was extremely ticklish, and Swayze's clear frustration at her inability to keep from laughing was 100% genuine.

Still, despite the fact that they reportedly didn't even speak to one another outside of their takes together, their chemistry in the finished film was undeniable, and today, it's a classic.

url: How do actors do kissing scenes?
text_blocks:
How do actors do kissing scenes?,'
',Kissing scenes in movies and television are carefully choreographed and managed to ensure the comfort and professionalism of the actors involved. Here's an overview of how actors approach kissing scenes:

Clear Communication: Before filming intimate scenes, actors typically have a meeting with the director and each other to discuss boundaries, comfort levels, and the overall vision for the scene. This helps establish trust and ensures that everyone is on the same page.
Consent and Boundaries: Actors have the right to establish boundaries and communicate what they are comfortable with during intimate scenes. This may include specifying the intensity of the kiss, the duration, or any specific actions they are not comfortable performing.
Closed Set: Filming intimate scenes is often done on a closed set with minimal crew members present. This helps create a more private and comfortable environment for the actors.
Professionalism: Actors approach kissing scenes with a high level of professionalism. They understand that it's part of their job and is meant to convey a certain emotion or narrative, rather than being a personal experience.
Rehearsals: Just like any other scene, kissing scenes are rehearsed to ensure that the actors and the director are satisfied with the performance. This helps in blocking out the scene, determining camera angles, and making sure that everyone is comfortable with the choreography.
Use of Body Doubles: In some cases, body doubles may be used for certain parts of intimate scenes. This allows the actors to maintain a level of comfort while still achieving the desired visual effect.
Special Effects: Sometimes, special effects may be used to enhance or simulate a kissing scene. This could involve camera angles, lighting, or other techniques that create the illusion of a kiss without the actors making physical contact.
Professional Advice: Actors may seek advice from intimacy coordinators or directors who specialize in filming intimate scenes. These professionals can provide guidance on choreography, communication, and creating a safe environment on set.

Overall, the key is to prioritize the well-being and comfort of the actors involved while ensuring that the scene effectively communicates the intended emotion or story. Clear communication, respect for boundaries, and a collaborative approach are crucial in handling kissing scenes in a professional manner.

url: What happened to the actress Ashley Judd in the Congo rainforest?
text_blocks:
What happened to the actress Ashley Judd in the Congo rainforest?,'
',In February 2021, actress Ashley Judd had a terrifying experience in the Congo rainforest. She was there for her conservation work, which includes efforts to protect the bonobo, an endangered great ape that is native to the area. Unfortunately, while she was in the rainforest, Judd had a major accident.

Judd tripped over a fallen tree in the dark, which resulted in a devastating leg injury. She broke her leg in four places and suffered nerve damage. The situation was dire because of the remote location of the accident in the rainforest, far from medical facilities.

The rescue and evacuation were intense and difficult. Judd received initial care from her colleagues, who stabilized her as best they could. She then underwent a grueling 55-hour ordeal to get to a hospital. This journey involved being carried by her team for hours to a place where she could be transported by motorcycle. During this motorcycle journey, Judd had to hold up her badly injured leg to avoid further damage. Eventually, she was flown to South Africa for surgery.

Ashley Judd's accident highlighted the risks faced by those working in remote and challenging environments, but it also underscored her commitment to her conservation work. Despite the severity of her injury and the intense experience, Judd remained dedicated to her activism and causes. Her recovery process involved extensive physical therapy, and she has been open about the challenges and successes of that journey.

url: What sort of networking happens behind the scenes of movie production?
text_blocks:
What sort of networking happens behind the scenes of movie production?,'
',Directors and producers often mingle with each other, stopping by each others sets to check in and give each other advice.

They also often hook each other up with good scripts and ideas too.

There‚Äôs a well known instance:

Steven Spielberg and George Lucas were, famously, good friends.

In the early 1970s, George Lucas had written the basic storyline and script for The Adventures of Indiana Smith. His first iteration would be about the Ark, which he had learned about from, of all people, his dentist.

He was at the beach with Spielberg, and they were building a sandcastle while talking about the film business.

While working on this sandcastle, Lucas pitched his idea to Spielberg, describing his concept of a James Bond-like character who was a rough and tumble archaelogist. He described the opening scene of the movie, that was meant to have a King Kong like feel.

Spielberg loved the idea but suggested he change the name from Indiana Smith to Indiana Jones as it would have a better ring to it.

As they continued to work on the sand castle, Lucas then asked him to sign on to do the film, under the condition that he did all 3 (Lucas loved doing trilogies). Spielberg liked the idea but he didn‚Äôt want to be working on films that didn‚Äôt already have scripts written as he would end up having to write the script himself.(Source: Marcus Hearn (2005). The Cinema of George Lucas)

Lucas then told him, that the other two were written. And so Spielberg signed on.

But it was a lie. Only one script had been written. But it was good old white lie at that. Lucas eventually wrote the other two scripts for Spielberg.

And the trilogy became well known classic cinema.

Both of them have gone on to fantastic wealth and fame, both now worth several billion dollars, and still good friends to this day.

url: Can you name some of your favorite underrated characters from the MCU movies/series?
text_blocks:
Can you name some of your favorite underrated characters from the MCU movies/series?,'
',My first pick is War Machine. I feel like he often gets overlooked because Iron Man outshines him. But the amount of fire power he's packing is insane. He doesn't have many note worthy feats. But his short showing in Infinity War was unbelievable. He may not be Tony. But he's still a powerful hero in his own right. Not enough people acknowledge that. Just look at how many Outriders he's taking out.

Another character that doesn't get the credit that he deserves is Ant-Man. I don't know what it is. He has the power to turn microscopic. Then grow two hundred feet. All in an instant. He knocked a Leviathan out of the air with a single punch. Even crushed Cull Obsidian who could match the Hulk Buster. His powers ‚Äúgrew‚Äù tremendously in Quantumania. With him now being able to press Kang.

Namor was a beast in Wakanda Forever. There was nothing that could stop him. He was throwing around Wakandan air ships like they were toys. Even at his absolute weakest; he was still too much for Black Panther to handle.

Drax is criminally underrated. He took attacks from Thanos himself. Even laughed at hitting trees at re-entry speeds. The only reason he doesn't get more respect, is because his character is treated as a joke. As in everything he does has to be funny.

Valkyrie is another insanely underrated character. She went toe-to-toe with Hela. While she didn't win, she still held her ground. She's shown to be Asgard‚Äôs greatest warrior. Even beating Loki. Who's pretty underrated in his own right.

My last pick is Kurse. His feats speak for themselves. He absolutely destroyed Thor any time they came into contact. He stopped Mjolnir from returning to Thor's hand pretty easily. Kurse was so powerful that a black hole grenade was the only thing that could take him out.

url: What killed Hollywood actress Debra Winger s career in films?
text_blocks:
What killed Hollywood actress Debra Winger s career in films?,'
',The downfall of Hollywood actress Debra Winger‚Äôs career in films can be attributed to a series of unfortunate incidents. One such incident occurred during the casting process of the movie ‚ÄúRomancing The Stone‚Äù in 1984. According to Michael Douglas, Winger was initially set to co-star in the film but lost the role to Kathleen Turner due to a bizarre biting incident.

It all started when Douglas and Winger decided to have a few tequilas with their dinner. As they stepped outside, Douglas playfully punched Winger on her arm, resulting in her retaliating by biting him. The situation took an unexpected turn when Douglas realized that she had broken his skin.

Feeling uncomfortable about working alongside Winger after this incident, Douglas approached director Robert Zemeckis and expressed his concerns. He confessed, ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt go to the jungle with her. I can‚Äôt do it.‚Äù

Another contributing factor to Winger‚Äôs career decline was her strained relationship with Shirley MacLaine during the filming of ‚ÄúTerms of Endearment‚Äù in 1983. Despite playing loving mother and daughter on-screen, rumors circulated about Winger‚Äôs disruptive behavior on set. One incident that gained attention was when she allegedly lifted her dress and farted in MacLaine‚Äôs direction, causing significant frustration for her co-star.

These incidents, along with other reported antics, ultimately led to a decline in Winger‚Äôs opportunities in the film industry. It serves as a reminder of how interpersonal dynamics and controversial behavior can impact an actor‚Äôs career trajectory.

url: How many movies did Shirley Temple make as an adult?
text_blocks:
How many movies did Shirley Temple make as an adult?,'
',Shirley Temple is a name synonymous with childhood stardom, probably the most iconic child actor there ever was.

But when we pivot to her adult life, the scene is quite different. She didn't quite have the same meteoric career as she transitioned into more mature roles. In fact, she only made a handful of movies as an adult.

Her adult film career had about five films, a stark contrast to the 20 or so hit films she made as America's little darling in the 1930s. Among these, some of the more notable titles include "The Bachelor and the Bobby-Soxer" and "That Hagen Girl," both of which were released when she was in her late teens. As the years rolled on, her presence on the silver screen quivered and waned.

What's even more fascinating about Shirley Temple is how she redefined herself after Hollywood. She embarked on a path that led her to become an ambassador, serving in Ghana and later in Czechoslovakia. Her story is a powerful reminder that the limelight of Hollywood can be just one act of an individual's life, not the defining feature.

Shirley Temple Black, as she was known in her political career, lived a life that surpassed the glow of her curly-haired, dimpled cheek persona that pirouetted into the hearts of a nation. Her journey reminds us that one can leap from the glitter of a Hollywood set to the gritty reality of global politics and diplomatic endeavors.

So, while her time as a box-office staple was brief when it came to her grown-up roles, Shirley Temple left a legacy that showcased depth, variety, and the resilience to redefine one's self time and time again ‚Äì a remarkable feat that far extends the reaches of any movie set. And if I may get personal for a moment, it's this part of her story that I find truly inspiring. Living here in Portland, Oregon, far from the golden glow of Tinseltown, I‚Äôm reminded that reinvention is a powerful script we can all write for ourselves.

url: What have you learned from being exposed to the wealthy ($10M+)?
text_blocks:
What have you learned from being exposed to the wealthy ($10M+)?,'
',They all have investments, but 99% of them have very little involvement in their investments.

They outsource all of their investments, taxes, etc. to a financial advisor. (Unless they have $50 million net worth or more, in which case it‚Äôs a wealth manager.)

A couple reasons for this:

Most importantly, people with financial advisors tend to beat the market by ~3%/year (according to a 2019 Vanguard Study). Index funds are okay, but an extra 3% adds up massively year over year.

They also have more money than time. So they prefer to let someone else handle the details while they live their lives.

Financial advisors also understand taxes, retirement funds, and other aspects of the financial system far better than the average person, which can save quite a bit every year all on its own.

From what I‚Äôve personally seen, affluent people generally network between themselves to find the best financial advisors. So if you have any well off friends, start there.

Comparison sites like WiserAdvisor
 can also help you find someone near you who has good reviews and a track record of success.

This form
 saves you some time by connecting you with advisors who specialize in your preferences, portfolio size, etc.

Hope that helps.

url: Do criminals in real life leave behind as much evidence as they do in movies?
text_blocks:
Do criminals in real life leave behind as much evidence as they do in movies?,'
',You‚Äôd be surprised how stupid criminals can be. I had one guy who tried to rape an escort in a hotel. She fought back. In his haste to leave he left his car keys on the hotel nightstand. The client left the room, she locked the door, he pleaded with her to hand the keys over, she said ‚Äúf*ck off!‚Äù, perp ran away and the victim gave the keys to the responding police. Cops used the fob to locate the car, tag came back to my guy and the rest is history.

The thing I cannot understand is how many criminals bring their cell phones with them to crime scenes. People‚Ä¶c‚Äômon! Police can get records for all numbers in an area for a specific time and trace the numbers to possible suspects. Kinda makes that whole defense of ‚ÄúI was nowhere near there‚Äù go right out the window.

url: How many sisters does the Disney princess Ariel have?
text_blocks:
How many sisters does the Disney princess Ariel have?,'
',Ariel's got herself something of a girl squad going on under the sea.

She has six sisters, and each of their names also begins with the letter 'A': they are Aquata, Andrina, Arista, Attina, Adella, and Alana. They‚Äôre the daughters of King Triton, making them all princesses of Atlantica. That‚Äôs a lot of royal blood floating around.

They don‚Äôt all get a huge amount of screen time in "The Little Mermaid," but they play bigger roles in some of the straight-to-video sequels and the prequel. Seems like a missed opportunity to not explore those relationships more. Being part of a big family can be pretty interesting, especially with the dynamics that come into play.

Growing up in Portland, OR, surrounded by the majesty of the Pacific Northwest's own waters, I sometimes imagine what it'd be like to have a family that big... or fins for that matter. I suspect there'd be a lot less room for the serene solitude I find hiking the lush trails of Forest Park or strolling down the banks of the Willamette River.

But hey, if I had a voice like Ariel's sisters, I‚Äôm not sure I could resist belting out tunes near the ocean, even if it‚Äôs just the salty breeze from the Oregon Coast instead of the warm currents of the Caribbean.
